content: What popular video streaming platform, owned by Google, was originally intended to be a dating site?

Oh, that's an interesting question! I think I might know the answer to that. The popular video streaming platform you're referring to is YouTube. Yes, YouTube was originally intended to be a dating site. It was created by three former PayPal employees, Chad Hurley, Steve Chen, and Jawed Karim. They launched it in February 2005, and it quickly evolved into the video-sharing giant we know today. Google acquired YouTube in October 2006 for $1.65 billion in stock. So, YouTube started as a dating site but transformed into one of the largest platforms for watching and sharing videos on the internet.
